## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`ufw`](#ufw): Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.   Be careful calling this class alone, it will by default enable ufw and disable all

* [`ufw::install`](#ufwinstall): Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.
* [`ufw::params`](#ufwparams): Class to manage ufw parameters.  Dont include this class directly.
* [`ufw::service`](#ufwservice): Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.

## Classes

### `ufw`

Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.

 Be careful calling this class alone, it will by default enable ufw
and disable all incoming traffic.

#### Examples

##### when declaring the ufw class

```puppet
include ufw
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `ufw` class.

##### `allow`

Data type: `Hash`

Set of connections to allow. default: {}

Default value: `$::ufw::params::allow`

##### `deny`

Data type: `Hash`

Set of connections to deny. default: {}

Default value: `$::ufw::params::deny`

##### `deny_outgoing`

Data type: `Boolean`

Block out going connections. default:false

Default value: `$::ufw::params::deny_outgoing`

##### `forward`

Data type: `Enum['ACCEPT','DROP','REJECT']`

Behavior for forwards. default: DROP

Default value: `$::ufw::params::forward`

##### `limit`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash of connections to limit. default: {}

Default value: `$::ufw::params::limit`

##### `log_level`

Data type: `Enum['off','low','medium','high','full']`

Level to log with. default: low

Default value: `$::ufw::params::log_level`

##### `manage_service`

Data type: `Boolean`

Manage the service. default: true

Default value: `$::ufw::params::manage_service`

##### `reject`

Data type: `Hash`

Hash of connections to reject. default: {}

Default value: `$::ufw::params::reject`

##### `service_name`

Data type: `String`

Name of service to manage. default: ufw

Default value: `$::ufw::params::service_name`

### `ufw::config`

Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.

### `ufw::install`

Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.

### `ufw::params`

Class to manage ufw parameters.

Dont include this class directly.

### `ufw::service`

Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.

## Defined types

### `ufw::allow`

Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.

 Be careful calling this class alone, it will by default enable ufw
and disable all incoming traffic.

#### Examples

##### when declaring the ufw class

```puppet
ufw::allow { 'allow-ssh-from-all':
  port => '22',
}
```

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `ufw::allow` defined type.

##### `direction`

Data type: `Enum['IN','OUT']`

The first parameter for this class

Default value: `'IN'`

##### `ensure`

Data type: `Enum['absent','present']`

Enable of disable rule. default: present

Default value: `'present'`

##### `from`

Data type: `String`

Ip address to allow access from. default: any

Default value: `'any'`

##### `ip`

Data type: `String`

Ip address to allow access to. default: ''

Default value: `''`

##### `port`

Data type: `String`

Port to act on. default: all

Default value: `'all'`

##### `proto`

Data type: `Enum[ 'tcp','udp','any']`

Protocol to use. default: tcp

Default value: `'tcp'`

### `ufw::deny`

Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.

 Be careful calling this class alone, it will by default enable ufw
and disable all incoming traffic.

#### Examples


Installs and enables Ubuntu's "uncomplicated" firewall.

 Be careful calling this class alone, it will by default enable ufw
